Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class TokenStyle

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.TokenStyle
public final class TokenStyle extends Object
An immutable description of a visual style associated with a TokenType.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TokenStyle()
    Creates a new token style that draws text in the editor foreground colour.
    TokenStyle​(Color color)
    Creates a new token style with the specified colour.
    TokenStyle​(Color color, boolean bold, boolean italic)
    Creates a new token style with the specified attributes.
    TokenStyle​(Color color, boolean bold, boolean italic, boolean underline, boolean strikethrough, boolean inverse)
    Creates a new token style with the specified attributes.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Color
    getColor()
    Returns the text colour for this style, or null if the editor's foreground property will be used.
    boolean
    isBold()
    Returns true if this style will produce bold text.
    boolean
    isInverted()
    Returns true if this style will produce inverted text.
    boolean
    isItalic()
    Returns true if this style will produce italicized text.
    boolean
    isStrikethrough()
    Returns true if this style will produce struck-out text.
    boolean
    isUnderlined()
    Returns true if this style will produce underlined text.
    String
    toString()
    Returns a string that describes the style.

  • Constructor Details

    • TokenStyle

      public TokenStyle()
      Creates a new token style that draws text in the editor foreground colour. No other effects will be applied to the font.

    • TokenStyle

      public TokenStyle​(Color color)
      Creates a new token style with the specified colour. No other effects will be applied to the font.
      Parameters:
      color - the text colour (or null to use foreground colour)

    • TokenStyle

      public TokenStyle​(Color color, boolean bold, boolean italic)
      Creates a new token style with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      color - the text colour (or null to use foreground colour)
      bold - true if the text should be emboldened
      italic - true if text should be italicized

    • TokenStyle

      public TokenStyle​(Color color, boolean bold, boolean italic, boolean underline, boolean strikethrough, boolean inverse)
      Creates a new token style with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      color - the text colour (or null to use foreground colour)
      bold - true if the text should be emboldened
      italic - true if text should be italicized
      underline - true if text should be underlined
      strikethrough - true if the line should be struck out
      inverse - true if the foreground and background should be reversed

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public Color getColor()
      Returns the text colour for this style, or null if the editor's foreground property will be used.
      Returns:
      the text colour, or null

    • isItalic

      public boolean isItalic()
      Returns true if this style will produce italicized text.
      Returns:
      true if the style is italic

    • isBold

      public boolean isBold()
      Returns true if this style will produce bold text.
      Returns:
      true if the style is bold

    • isUnderlined

      public boolean isUnderlined()
      Returns true if this style will produce underlined text.
      Returns:
      true if the text is underlined

    • isStrikethrough

      public boolean isStrikethrough()
      Returns true if this style will produce struck-out text.
      Returns:
      true if the style strikes a line through the centre of the text

    • isInverted

      public boolean isInverted()
      Returns true if this style will produce inverted text.
      Returns:
      true if the text's background is inverted

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string that describes the style. The string is intended for debugging purposes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a debug string that describes this style
